884186f9-3998-4c7a-8b5a-9294e9e48825.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
884186f9-3998-4c7a-8b5a-9294e9e48825.chunk:
So, having looked at shortest path 
problems with weighted graphs,   we now look at a different problem, 
which is a Minimum Cost Spanning Tree.   So, minimum cost spanning tree is something 
that comes into play when we want to   analyze a graph, and see,

1dba320b-764b-43da-b4e6-c7e7f36431b7.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
1dba320b-764b-43da-b4e6-c7e7f36431b7.chunk:
how to 
recover a connected part of it. 
  So, for example, you could have a district where 
roads have been damaged by a cyclone and you want   to restore the roads. And your first priority 
is to make sure that you can go from everywhere   to everywhere

060f4e7d-80db-44b1-a5c3-26c127d27e40.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
060f4e7d-80db-44b1-a5c3-26c127d27e40.chunk:
. So, you want to make sure that the 
roads that are restored, connect all the vertices,   so, you could have some roads which are not 
restored, but you want to choose the roads   to restore which makes sure that after you 
have restored these roads, ever

225a6860-9477-45c3-bc62-7fc1d8cf9f04.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
225a6860-9477-45c3-bc62-7fc1d8cf9f04.chunk:
y town in that   district is reachable from every other town. 
So, which set of roads should you restore first?   And similar situation could appear 
in telecom. So, you have some fiber   optic network or some other kind of network, 
which serves a bunch o

74e95753-8e49-4de5-965b-502d7bcff027.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
74e95753-8e49-4de5-965b-502d7bcff027.chunk:
f customers. And now,   you may want to provide some kind of guarantee 
to the customers that their service will not   get disrupted, even if there is some kind of 
road digging along some of these roads. So,   these cables are all laid along the road. 
So

c852c7f7-0d07-496d-ad2c-cde58b184c66.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
c852c7f7-0d07-496d-ad2c-cde58b184c66.chunk:
, what you do is you lay a second set of cables,   which is on the opposite side of the road, 
for example, so that you make sure that if   one set is done, the other set is not done. 
Now, of course, you could duplicate all the   cables on all the roads,

0869f5b9-b6bb-456c-8630-d8b8478b601d.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
0869f5b9-b6bb-456c-8630-d8b8478b601d.chunk:
but is there a smaller 
set of cables that you can duplicate, so that   if you lay these cables, still everybody will be 
connected even if the original cables get cut. 
  So, this is a problem that is called a spanning 
tree. So, you want to take a graph,

332a2309-f8c7-4375-b3c1-fcbc66cc0fb1.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
332a2309-f8c7-4375-b3c1-fcbc66cc0fb1.chunk:
which has a   certain number of edges. They could be roads in 
the network or they could be these telecom fiber   connections, and you want to retain a minimal 
set of edges so that the graph remains connected.   So, a minimally connected graph is a 
tree

c38250e3-094c-4085-82c8-e14258c96a46.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
c38250e3-094c-4085-82c8-e14258c96a46.chunk:
. So, a tree is something which   on n vertices is n minus 1 edges. 
So, if you add an edge to a tree, you get a loop.   And if you remove an edge from a tree you get 
a disconnected graph. So, we want a tree, which   is a sort of smallest possible connect

9a8e57c6-f18c-4abe-b6cb-cc97dfb6706e.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
9a8e57c6-f18c-4abe-b6cb-cc97dfb6706e.chunk:
ed graph 
on n vertices, and we wanted to cover all the   vertices in the graph that we have. So, it spans 
that graph, so it is called a spanning tree. 
  Now, in general, you could have more than one 
spanning tree. So here for instance, the red   graph

78f634a6-8550-4728-9582-1d8efac84e81.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
78f634a6-8550-4728-9582-1d8efac84e81.chunk:
that we have drawn is a spanning tree it 
connects 0, 1, 3, 4, 2. So, it leaves out these   two edges and still it connects everything, so 
this is one spanning tree. We could also have   a spanning tree with these four edges 03, 31, 12 
and 24, which leav

693f811a-7641-484a-bd37-3e513c25c03e.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
693f811a-7641-484a-bd37-3e513c25c03e.chunk:
es out two different edges.
  So, when we are doing some practical 
problems, like the one we discussed   about relaying roads, or restoring or placing 
duplicate fiber optic cables, there is also   a cost associated with either relaying that 
road or main

43de23e4-fc6b-43ef-a622-6f146c97065c.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
43de23e4-fc6b-43ef-a622-6f146c97065c.chunk:
taining a cable of that point. So,   it is interesting to look at the spanning tree 
problem in the context of a weighted graph. 
  So, we do not have just an underlying graph, we 
have a weighted graph. And now we have a criterion   to choose between the

6d56be82-20fd-40de-adbc-c64c79cdebc3.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
6d56be82-20fd-40de-adbc-c64c79cdebc3.chunk:
different spanning trees. 
So, we said that, we could have multiple spanning   trees. But now, we can say that one spanning tree 
is better than another spanning tree, if it costs   less. So, this is a natural interpretation, where 
for instance, if I want

a59967c6-1b08-4dc0-8968-26674dfc2357.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
a59967c6-1b08-4dc0-8968-26674dfc2357.chunk:
to restore the roads as   fast as possible, and as cheaply as possible. 
I would like to restore a spanning tree of roads,   which costs the minimum and which takes 
least time to do. Same way, if I have   to maintain redundant links to my customers 
from

3c3322d2-3c99-483b-aea6-d9b9ba58859d.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
3c3322d2-3c99-483b-aea6-d9b9ba58859d.chunk:
a point of view of a service provider,   they want to spend as little as possible for 
this extra service that they are providing. 
  So, we are looking at these different possible 
spanning trees, and we are assessing their   value based on their weight.

bcf0207b-e540-464a-881c-1d9968fa7a48.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
bcf0207b-e540-464a-881c-1d9968fa7a48.chunk:
And what is the 
weight? Is just the sum of the costs of all   the edges that form that tree. So, just like 
we saw for a path, the weight of a path is the   sum of the weights along the path, here we have a 
tree, so these are all the edges that we need.

81aa5eb2-7e22-4f5a-b5df-d385df486dc0.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
81aa5eb2-7e22-4f5a-b5df-d385df486dc0.chunk:
Now, what tree gives us the 
total cost which is minimum?   And this is what we call a minimum cost 
spanning tree. So here for instance,   we have this weighted graph when 
we construct one spanning tree,   the red one, then this will have its weight

e14f93db-73b2-47de-8f11-8f7ae2d6f752.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
e14f93db-73b2-47de-8f11-8f7ae2d6f752.chunk:
which 
is 18 plus 70 plus 6 plus 20 which is 114. 
  But this is as we saw, not the only spanning tree, 
so we could also consider another spanning tree   which has 10 plus 6 plus 20 plus 8, and we get 
a drastic reduction in the cost from 114 to 44.   So,

cbd2545b-3044-412b-84a5-6d9cc8a96d7e.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
cbd2545b-3044-412b-84a5-6d9cc8a96d7e.chunk:
our goal is now to give given such a graph 
to identify the minimum cost spanning tree. 
  So, it is useful to remind ourselves of some 
basic things about tree. So, first of all, a tree,   as we said, is the smallest connected graph that 
connection that

88454909-b38f-41ad-a7cc-d94d8b92cf44.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
88454909-b38f-41ad-a7cc-d94d8b92cf44.chunk:
you can draw on a graph. So,   if you have n vertices, then a tree on those 
n vertices will have exactly n minus 1 edges.   So, one way of thinking about this is 
that, if you have a connected graph   then everything is in one component.
  Now, a tree is

995d4823-5a3f-4173-b982-f9ee6a5e10b9.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
995d4823-5a3f-4173-b982-f9ee6a5e10b9.chunk:
connected and acyclic, which means 
that, between any two vertices, there is no cycle,   so there is only one way to go from one vertex 
to another. So, if you take a graph like this a   tree and you cut it, at some point, it must 
fall apart into two com

08aa527d-21db-446d-a1b6-c13ff6003907.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
08aa527d-21db-446d-a1b6-c13ff6003907.chunk:
ponents. Because if   it does not fall apart in two components, 
it means there is a way to go around. 
  So, basically, if I have this and if I cut 
this vertex here, and I find that I can still   go from here to here, then originally there 
must have bee

27b60f05-3aba-4f18-9790-ba972f957932.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
27b60f05-3aba-4f18-9790-ba972f957932.chunk:
n a cycle. So, therefore, if I   delete an edge from a tree, I will add from 
one component I will go to two components.   Now, each of these is connected. 
Now again, there they are also trees.   If I cut thing I will go one more time and I have 
n vertic

e8125aab-67f3-49ca-95bd-f8d16afba70e.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
e8125aab-67f3-49ca-95bd-f8d16afba70e.chunk:
es originally. So, I have one component,   if I cut one vertex, I have two components, if 
I do this n minus 1 times I have n components,   but n components means I have n isolated 
vertices, no more edges, so I must have   started with n minus 1 edges. So

d67f47d0-0d2b-405c-a920-c5725fd36d9e.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
d67f47d0-0d2b-405c-a920-c5725fd36d9e.chunk:
, this is one 
argument saying that if we delete n minus 1   edges we will come to singleton vertices, so, 
the original tree had only n minus 1 edges. 
  Conversely, if I take a tree and add an edge, 
it must create a cycle for the same reason we   said b

1722c559-36fd-4c65-ac8c-9743b81d5938.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
1722c559-36fd-4c65-ac8c-9743b81d5938.chunk:
efore because you could already go from 
anywhere to anywhere. Now, if you add an edge,   you are adding another way to go. So, 
therefore, the new edge plus the old path,   so I have already a way to go from i to j and 
now I have added an edge directly f

20122698-6e34-4f28-9a3e-c1ed980a9784.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
20122698-6e34-4f28-9a3e-c1ed980a9784.chunk:
rom i to j   together this must form a cycle. So, adding 
an edge to a tree will form a cycle. 
  So, the third property is that if I take any two 
elements into vertices in a tree, then there will   be only one path between them. And they will 
be exactly

3b6d8676-3944-474f-82fb-b9c804b7932d.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
3b6d8676-3944-474f-82fb-b9c804b7932d.chunk:
one because they are connected,   but there will be only one. Because if there 
were two then you can see like this, you can   go two different ways, then there must be some 
place where these paths diverged and join. So,   it could be at i and j or some

20a1585c-fb2f-472f-96f1-ca0ca4435369.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
20a1585c-fb2f-472f-96f1-ca0ca4435369.chunk:
intermediate point, 
so there must be a cycle somewhere in the graph.   So, if you add multiple paths between two 
vertices, you cannot be having a tree. 
  So, any of these facts, basically, any two of 
these tell you that something is a tree. So,   if it

78d6846e-50bd-4b94-b86a-a6aed43de228.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
78d6846e-50bd-4b94-b86a-a6aed43de228.chunk:
is connected an acyclic then it must be 
a tree, if it is connected and it has n minus 1   edges, it must be a tree, if it is acyclic and 
it has n minus 1 edges it must be a tree. So,   all of these basically any two of these tell you 
that you have a tr

ee and I imply the third.
  So, why do we need this? Well, we actually 
use these facts when we are building spanning   tree. So, we will have two strategies to build 
spanning tree. So, one will basically start with   a small edge and try to grow a tree b

1d00ed3f-df9d-4312-ae6f-a482fccffbab.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
1d00ed3f-df9d-4312-ae6f-a482fccffbab.chunk:
y adding 
smaller edges. So, this will be similar to our   shortest path kind of strategy, where we try 
to add edges as minimally as possible. 
  And the other one we will basically try to create 
a small graph, which is not a tree but in between   I may

7a292c4e-e437-496c-a6f4-6763ac430e74.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
7a292c4e-e437-496c-a6f4-6763ac430e74.chunk:
not have yet a tree. So, I might have 
components, but I will try to avoid cycles,   but I will pick up, since I know I want the 
smallest possible spanning tree I will pick up   the edges in ascending order of cost. And 
if I can add it to my tree, I will

87566f61-9d36-420d-a945-57b3d259b541.title: Minimum Cost Spanning Trees
87566f61-9d36-420d-a945-57b3d259b541.chunk:
add it   if I cannot add it, I will throw it away. So, 
the first algorithm is called Prim’s algorithm   and the second one is called Kruskal’s 
algorithm, and we will study both of them.
